page.title: 19COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: From the edge of Winter Hill to the east the marked north-south axis of the communications stands out. Across to the west Blackrod, possibly meaning "The Dark Way" holds the line of what was an ancient ridgeway.Latterly this became the A6 but such was the weight of traffic through the tight main street that the bypass was built below the village in the 1930s. Another dark line across the view is the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway of 1840, still an important link from Manchester to the main line north, with a station at the foot of Blackrod. The M61 motorway is the next line across the landscape,always seeming to carry more towards Manchester than it carries away-apart from peak holiday times. From the hillside our block appears to be one people pass through!
